metadata.title: CVE-2022-2743 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in Window Manager in Google Chrome on Chrome OS and Lacrosprior to 104.0.5112.79 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user toengage in specific UI interactions to perform an out of bounds memory writevia crafted UI interactions. (Chrome security severity: High)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '104.0.5112.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
